error.message: Potential content overflow detected in ".category-progress-bar". This may hide text content inaccessibly. How to fix: - Verify all content remains accessible when overflow is hidden - Consider using "overflow: auto" or "overflow: scroll" for scrollable content - Ensure responsive design allows content to reflow at 320px width WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow

Animation without prefers-reduced-motion support. Animations can cause vestibular disorders and motion sickness How to fix: - Add @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) query - Disable or reduce animation when preference is set WCAG 2.3.3: Animation from Interactions Found: File uses animations and transitions without properly disabling them in prefers-reduced-motion: redu...

Font size 11px may be too small. Small text is difficult for users with low vision How to fix: - Use minimum 16px (1rem) for body text - Use relative units (rem, em) for scalability - Test at 200% zoom WCAG 1.4.4: Resize Text Found: ".add-custom-item"

Content may be hidden without visual indication in "Visually hidden utility for screen readers .visually-hidden". Text content may be cut off and inaccessible to users. How to fix: - Add "text-overflow: ellipsis" to show truncation indicator (...) - Or remove "overflow: hidden" to allow text to wrap naturally - Or ensure content is accessible through other means (tooltips, expand buttons) WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow

visibility: hidden element may be in tab order. Focusable hidden elements confuse keyboard navigation How to fix: - Add tabindex="-1" to hidden elements - Use display: none to remove from tab order - Manage focus when showing/hiding WCAG 2.4.3: Focus Order Found: // Blurred background image .image-background

Invalid "scope" attribute on <div> element with value "col". The scope attribute is only valid on <th> elements and helps screen readers understand table structure. How to fix: - Remove the scope attribute from <div> element - If this should be a header cell, change <div> to <th> and use scope="row" or scope="col" - Use scope="rowgroup" or scope="colgroup" for headers spanning multiple rows/columns WCAG 1.3.1: Info and Relationships (Level A) Found: <div> with scope attribute

Content may be hidden without visual indication in "Accessibility: Screen reader only text .sr-only". Text content may be cut off and inaccessible to users. How to fix: - Add "text-overflow: ellipsis" to show truncation indicator (...) - Or remove "overflow: hidden" to allow text to wrap naturally - Or ensure content is accessible through other means (tooltips, expand buttons) WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow

Touch target below 24px minimum (WCAG AA). Users with motor impairments cannot reliably activate How to fix: - Ensure minimum 24x24px clickable area (44x44px recommended) WCAG 2.5.5: Target Size | See: https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/target-size Found: <button> (height: 1px effective)
